docs.title: Settings Manager
docs.text:
Automate your GitHub Settings

Settings Manager automates your GitHub settings, no matter if you have a couple of personal repositories, or manage a large organization account.

docs.title: Key features and design principles
docs.text:
• Get started today: Only configure what is important
  • Powerful syntax: Set defaults at high level, override at lower level

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Navigate to https://github.com/apps/repo-settings-manager
Install GitHub App page

docs.title: Branches
docs.text: Branches settings page

docs.title: Example configuration
docs.text:
branches:
  - name: develop
    protection:
      required_pull_request_reviews:
        required_approving_review_count: 1

docs.title: Collaborators
docs.text: Collaborators settings page

docs.title: Example configuration
docs.text:
collaborator:
  - username: torvalds
    permission: admin

docs.title: General
docs.text: General settings page

docs.title: description
docs.text:
Short description of the repository.

Example:

general:
  description: Repository description goes here

docs.title: homepage
docs.text:
URL with more information about the repository.

Example:

general:
  homepage: https://example.com

docs.title: private
docs.text:
Either true to make the repository private or false to make it public.

Example:

general:
  private: false

docs.title: security_and_analysis
docs.text:
Specify which security and analysis features to enable or disable for the repository.

Example:

general:
  security_and_analysis:
    advanced_security:
      status: enabled
    code_security:
      status: enabled
    secret_scanning:
      status: enabled
    secret_scanning_push_protection:
      status: disabled
    secret_scanning_ai_detection: 
      status: disabled
    secret_scanning_non_provider_patterns:
      status: disabled

docs.title: has_issues
docs.text:
Either true to enable issues for this repository or false to disable them.

Example:

general:
  has_issues: false

docs.title: has_projects
docs.text:
Either true to enable projects for this repository or false to disable them.

Example:

general:
  has_projects: false

docs.title: has_wiki
docs.text:
Either true to enable the wiki for this repository or false to disable it.

Example:

general:
  has_wiki: false

docs.title: is_template
docs.text:
Either true to make this repo available as a template repository or false to prevent it.

Example:

general:
  is_template: true

docs.title: default_branch
docs.text:
Updates the default branch for this repository.

Example:

general:
  default_branch: develop

docs.title: allow_squash_merge
docs.text:
Either true to allow squash-merging pull requests, or false to prevent squash-merging.

Example:

general:
  allow_squash_merge: true

docs.title: allow_merge_commit
docs.text:
Either true to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or false to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits.

Example:

general:
  allow_merge_commit: false

docs.title: allow_rebase_merge
docs.text:
Either true to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or false to prevent rebase-merging.

Example:

general:
  allow_rebase_merge: false

docs.title: allow_auto_merge
docs.text:
Either true to allow auto-merge on pull requests, or false to disallow auto-merge.

Example:

general:
  allow_auto_merge: true

docs.title: delete_branch_on_merge
docs.text:
Either true to allow automatically deleting head branches when pull requests are merged, or false to prevent automatic deletion.

Example:

general:
  delete_branch_on_merge: true

docs.title: allow_update_branch
docs.text:
Either true to always allow a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch to be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging, or false otherwise.

Example:

general:
  allow_update_branch: true

docs.title: squash_merge_commit_title
docs.text:
Required when using squash_merge_commit_message.

The default value for a squash merge commit title:

  • PR_TITLE: default to the pull request's title.
  • COMMIT_OR_PR_TITLE: default to the commit's title (if only one commit) or the pull request's title (when more than one commit).
general:
  squash_merge_commit_title: PR_TITLE

docs.title: squash_merge_commit_message
docs.text:
The default value for a squash merge commit message:

  • PR_BODY: default to the pull request's body.
  • COMMIT_MESSAGES: default to the branch's commit messages.
  • BLANK: default to a blank commit message.
general:
  squash_merge_commit_message: PR_BODY

docs.title: merge_commit_title
docs.text:
Required when using merge_commit_message.

The default value for a merge commit title.

  • PR_TITLE: default to the pull request's title.
  • MERGE_MESSAGE: default to the classic title for a merge message (e.g., Merge pull request #123 from branch-name).
general:
  merge_commit_title: PR_TITLE

docs.title: merge_commit_message
docs.text:
The default value for a merge commit message.

  • PR_TITLE: default to the pull request's title.
  • PR_BODY: default to the pull request's body.
  • BLANK: default to a blank commit message.
general:
  merge_commit_message: PR_BODY

docs.title: archived
docs.text:
Whether to archive this repository. false will unarchive a previously archived repository.

general:
  archived: true

docs.title: allow_forking
docs.text:
Either true to allow private forks, or false to prevent private forks.

general:
  allow_forking: false

docs.title: web_commit_signoff_required
docs.text:
Either true to require contributors to sign off on web-based commits, or false to not require contributors to sign off on web-based commits.

general:
  web_commit_signoff_required: true

docs.title: Labels
docs.text: Labels settings page

docs.title: Example configuration
docs.text:
labels:
  - name: My label
    description: My label description goes here
    color: 00ff00
